original.name: Coldsleep Ship
original.body: Once complete, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to gain a new colony on any planet in any other player's system where you don't already have one. You may place up to four ships on that colony, moving them from your other colonies or this tech card.

revised.name: Coldsleep Ship
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to gain a new colony on any planet in any other player's system where you don't already have one. You may place up to four ships on that colony from your other colonies or this tech card. If you have no colonies to return your researching ships to when you complete this tech, you may immediately use this tech to gain your new colony using all of those ships.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited to fix the ship leak. The original text is trying to let the player use his researching ships "from this tech card," but it is impossible for there to be any ships on this card when it is used. The rulebook makes it clear that when a tech is completed, its researching ships must be returned to other colonies before using the tech. In most cases this is not a problem, though: since the card allows moving ships from any of the player's colonies, he can in fact use his (former) research ships anyway from the colonies he sent them to instead of "from this tech card." Thus, this part of the tech's text (say that three times fast) is completely unnecessary â€” except in the rare situation where a player has no colonies at all for his ships to land on, or when Engineer is using his power to research this tech. Were it not for these rare situations, we could simply delete the incorrect phrase, "or this tech card." Instead, to prevent the researching ships from all going to the warp in the first rare case, a new sentence is required to make the card work as intended. This leaves us one remaining question: "Since Coldsleep Ship requires 9 ships to research and allows 4 of them to go onto the new colony, what happens to the other 5 if the player has no other colonies?" To answer that question, the revision presented here allows all nine ships to land on the new colony when the player has no other option.

original.name: Collapsium Hulls
original.body: Once completed, this tech stays in play. While it is in play, when you lose an encounter as the defense by 5 or less, one of your ships may remain on the planet instead of going to the warp. Your ship coexists with any ships that establish a colony on the planet during the encounter.

revised.name: Collapsium Hulls
revised.body: When you lose an encounter as the defense by 5 or less, one of your ships may remain on the planet instead of going to the warp.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited to delete unnecessary coexist language.


Revisions from The Praw

Edited for consistency with Odyssey techs.

original.name: Cosmic Field Generator
original.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech to cancel one use of any alien's power, including your own. That power may not be used again during the current encounter. The use of this tech is considered to be a "Cosmic Zap," but this is not an artifact card.

revised.name: Cosmic Field Generator
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech to cancel one use of any alien's power, including your own. That power may not be used again during the current encounter. The use of this tech is considered to be a "Cosmic Zap," but this is not an artifact card.

original.name: Delta Scanners
original.body: Once complete, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to take any one card from the discard pile and add it to your hand.

revised.name: Delta Scanners
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to take any one card from the discard pile and add it to your hand.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited for wording consistency.

original.name: Energy Cloak
original.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech when you are the offense after aiming the hyperspace gate. The defense may not invite any players to ally with him or her during this encounter.

revised.name: Energy Cloak
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech as the offense after aiming the hyperspace gate. The defense may not invite any players to ally with him or her during this encounter.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited for wording consistency.

original.name: Enigma Device
original.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter. Each player, starting with you and continuing clockwise, either draws cards from the deck or discards cards at random as needed to bring his or her hand to exactly eight cards. You (and only you) may discard as many of your cards as you wish beforehand.

revised.name: Enigma Device
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter. Each player, starting with you and continuing clockwise, either draws cards from the deck or discards cards at random as needed to bring his or her hand to exactly eight cards. You (and only you) may discard as many of your cards as you wish beforehand.

original.name: Genesis Bomb
original.body: Do not reveal this tech until used. You may reveal and discard this tech at the start of any player's encounter to take the Genesis planet and place it in your home system. You may immediately gain a colony on it using any or all of the ships used to research this tech.

revised.name: Genesis Bomb
revised.body: Do not reveal this tech until used. You may reveal and discard this tech at the start of any encounter to take the Genesis planet and place it in your home system. You may immediately gain a colony on it using any or all of the ships used to research this tech.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited for wording consistency.

original.name: Gluon Mines
original.body: Do not reveal this tech until used. You may reveal and discard this tech as the defense after encounter cards are selected but before they are revealed to send one attacking ship to the warp for each ship researching this tech. If there are no attacking ships left afterwards, you win this encounter, otherwise, it continues normally.

revised.name: Gluon Mines
revised.body: Do not reveal this tech until used. You may reveal and discard this tech as the defense after encounter cards are selected but before they are revealed to send one opposing ship of your choice to the warp for each ship researching this tech. If there are no opposing ships left afterwards, you win this encounter. Otherwise, it continues normally.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited to clarify who chooses the ships and to fix the attack bug.

original.name: Infinity Drive
original.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the end of any encounter (including your own) to immediately have an encounter. Afterwards, play resumes from where it left off.

revised.name: Infinity Drive
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the end of any encounter (including your own) to immediately have an encounter (if you have an encounter card in your hand). Afterwards, play resumes from where it left off.
revised.revisionNotes: Edited to add reminder text that you cannot begin an encounter without an encounter card in your hand.

original.name: Lunar Cannon
original.body: When you complete this tech, take and place the lunar cannon token between two of your home planets. While this tech is in play, you control the lunar cannon. When you are a main player or an ally, you may add 10 to your side's total in any encounters targeting a world next to the lunar cannon. Each time a wild destiny card is drawn, you may move the lunar cannon token to a new position in any system.

revised.name: Lunar Cannon
revised.body: When you complete this tech, take and place the lunar cannon token between two of your home planets. While this tech is in play, you control the lunar cannon. As a main player or ally, you may add 10 to your side's total in any encounters targeting a world next to the lunar cannon. Each time a wild destiny card is drawn, you may move the lunar cannon token to a new position in any system.

original.name: Omega Missile
original.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to choose a planet in any system. Remove that planet from the game and send all ships on it to the warp.

revised.name: Omega Missile
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to choose a planet in any system. Remove that planet from the game and send all ships on it to the warp.

original.name: Plasma Thrusters
original.body: Once completed, this tech stays in play. While it is in play, you may launch one extra ship into each encounter as the offense or an ally (for a total of five, normally). As the defense, you may move one ship to your planet being attacked from any of your other colonies during the launch phase.

revised.name: Plasma Thrusters
revised.body: As the offense or an ally, you may send one extra ship into each encounter (for a total of five, normally). As the defense, during the launch phase, you may move one ship to the targeted planet from any of your other colonies.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited to fix the launch bug and the attack bug, to avoid implying that you can use this tech on defense only if you are defending one of "your" planets, and to add missing timing indicator.


Revisions from The Praw

Edited for consistency with Odyssey techs.

original.name: Precursor Seed
original.body: When you complete this tech, draw a random alien power and place it faceup in front of you. If it is an alien with Game Setup text or an alien not allowed in this game, discard it and draw again. While this tech is in play, you may use the extra alien power you have drawn in addition to your own.

revised.name: Precursor Seed
revised.body: When you complete this tech, draw an unused alien power at random. If the alien has Game Setup text or is not allowed in the current game, discard it and draw again. While this tech is in play, you use the extra alien power you have drawn in addition to your own.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited to eliminate the implication that a mandatory power can be treated as optional.

original.name: The Prometheus
original.body: When you complete this tech, take the Prometheus token and place it on one of your colonies. While this tech is in play, you control the Prometheus, which is treated in all ways as one of your ships except that it adds an extra +3 to your side's total when it participates in an encounter.

revised.name: The Prometheus
revised.body: When you complete this tech, take the Prometheus token and place it on one of your colonies. While this tech is in play, you control the Prometheus, which is treated in all ways as one of your ships except that it adds an extra +3 to your side's total when it is involved in an encounter.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited for consistency.

original.name: The Qax
original.body: Once complete, you may give this tech to another player when you invite them to ally with you. They must ally with you and send 4 ships, although they are not required to abandon any colonies in order to do so. That player may later give this tech to another player (including you) and so on.

revised.name: The Qax
revised.body: Once completed, you may give this tech to another player when you invite them to ally with you. That player must ally with you and send 4 ships (or as many as possible up to 4), although they are not required to abandon any colonies in order to do so. That player may later give this tech to another player (including you) and so on.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited for grammar and to implement the FAQ ruling on Macron.

original.name: Quark Battery
original.body: When you complete this card, place an encounter card from your hand facedown under it. This card is not considered part of your hand and may not be looked at or taken by other players. Later, after cards are revealed in an encounter in which you are a main player, you may discard this tech to replace your revealed encounter card with the one under this card.

revised.name: Quark Battery
revised.body: When you complete this tech, place an encounter card from your hand facedown under it. This encounter card is not part of your hand and may not be looked at or taken by other players. As a main player, after encounter cards are revealed, you may discard this tech to discard your revealed encounter card and replace it with the one under this tech.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited to define what happens to the replaced card.


Revisions from The Praw

Edited for clarity and wording consistency.

original.name: Tech Scrambler
original.body: Do not reveal this tech until used. You may reveal and discard this tech at any time to cancel the effect of any one other tech card. The canceled tech must have a research cost equal or less than the number of ships researching this tech. The canceled tech is discarded from play.

revised.name: Tech Scrambler
revised.body: Do not reveal this tech until used. You may reveal and discard this tech at any time to cancel the effect of any one other tech card. The canceled tech must have a research cost equal to or less than the number of ships researching this tech. The canceled tech card is discarded.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited for grammar and to avoid sounding like the affected tech is removed from the game.

original.name: Vacuum Turbines
original.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to draw four cards from the deck. Look at them and add any of them you wish to your hand, discarding the rest.

revised.name: Vacuum Turbines
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech at the start of any encounter to draw four cards from the deck. Look at them and add any of them you wish to your hand, discarding the rest.

original.name: Warpspace Key
original.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech during the regroup phase of one of your encounters to free all of your ships from the warp. Freed ships return to any of your colonies.

revised.name: Warpspace Key
revised.body: Once completed, you may discard this tech during your regroup phase to retrieve all of your ships from the warp. Freed ships return to any of your colonies.

original.name: Xenon Lasers
original.body: Once completed, this tech stays in play. While it is in play, you may either add 1 to, or subtract 1 from, your side's total after encounter cards are revealed when you are a main player or ally.

revised.name: Xenon Lasers
revised.body: As a main player or ally, after encounter cards are revealed, you may either add 1 to, or subtract 1 from, your side's total.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from the Cosmodex

Edited for wording consistency.


Revisions from The Praw

Edited for clarity and further consistency with Odyssey techs.

original.name: Destiny Holo-Flux
original.body: After destiny is drawn, you may reset this tech to discard that destiny card. If you do, the offense draws another destiny card.

revised.name: Destiny Holo-Flux
revised.body: After destiny is drawn, you may reset this tech to discard that destiny card. If you do, the offense draws another destiny card.

original.name: Freewheeling Projector
original.body: You can play more than one flare card per encounter. (Each flare can be played only once per encounter.)

revised.name: Freewheeling Projector
revised.body: You can play more than one flare card per encounter. (Each flare can be played only once per encounter.)

original.name: Lucky Charm
original.body: During the regroup phase, you may discard this tech to free one of your ships from the warp.

revised.name: Lucky Charm
revised.body: During the regroup phase, you may discard this tech to free one of your ships from the warp.

original.name: Power Radiant
original.body: You may discard an alien's flare to cancel one use of that alien's power. That power cannot be used again during this encounter. (This is not treated as a Cosmic Zap.)

revised.name: Power Radiant
revised.body: You may discard an alien's flare to cancel one use of that alien's power. That power cannot be used again during this encounter. (This is not treated as a Cosmic Zap.)

original.name: Proximity Mining
original.body: At any time, you may send one ship belonging to another player from a colony to the warp. If you do, reset this tech and give it to that player.

revised.name: Proximity Mining
revised.body: At any time, you may send one ship belonging to another player from a colony to the warp. If you do, reset this tech and give it to that player.

original.name: Station Dock
original.body: During the regroup phase, you may discard this tech to draw three space station cards (even if the Space Station variant (ðŸ•®13) is not being used). Choose one to put into play in your home system and shuffle the other back into the space station deck.

revised.name: Station Dock
revised.body: During the regroup phase, you may discard this tech to draw three space station cards (even if the Space Station variant [ðŸ•®13]is not being used). Choose one to put into play in your home system and shuffle the other back into the space station deck.

original.name: Warp Breaker
original.body: At any time, you may reset this tech to free all of your ships from the warp.

revised.name: Warp Breaker
revised.body: At any time, you may reset this tech to free all of your ships from the warp.

original.name: Cosmic Catapult
original.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

During the reveal phase, if a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech. For each ship on it, add 3 to one side's total. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

revised.name: Cosmic Catapult
revised.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

During the reveal phase, if a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech. For each ship on it, add 3 to one side's total. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

original.name: Nuclear Missiles
original.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose a planet. For each ship on this tech, send one ship to the warp from the chosen planet. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

revised.name: Nuclear Missiles
revised.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose a planet. For each ship on this tech, send one ship to the warp from the chosen planet. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

original.name: Sabotage
original.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose one or more techs; a tech that has more ships on it than this tech cannot be chosen. All ships on the chosen techs return to their owner's colonies. Then, discard this tech, send all ships on it to the warp, and draw another tech.

revised.name: Sabotage
revised.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose one or more techs; a tech that has more ships on it than this tech cannot be chosen. All ships on the chosen techs return to their owner's colonies. Then, discard this tech, send all ships on it to the warp, and draw another tech.

original.name: Strange Attractor
original.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to reveal all flares in the discard pile an in each other player's hand. For each ship on this tech, take one revealed flare of your choice and add it to your hand. This, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

revised.name: Strange Attractor
revised.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to reveal all flares in the discard pile an in each other player's hand. For each ship on this tech, take one revealed flare of your choice and add it to your hand. This, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

original.name: Thorium Rod
original.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose a player. For each ship on this tech, that player discards a card at random from their hand. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

revised.name: Thorium Rod
revised.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to choose a player. For each ship on this tech, that player discards a card at random from their hand. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

original.name: Treasure Drones
original.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to shuffle either the cosmic or the reward deck discard pile. For each ship on this tech, draw a card from that discard pile. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

revised.name: Treasure Drones
revised.body:
You cannot complete this tech.

While a hazard warning is active, you may reveal this tech to shuffle either the cosmic or the reward deck discard pile. For each ship on this tech, draw a card from that discard pile. Then, discard this tech and send all ships on it to the warp.

original.name: Galactose Intolerance
original.body: Discard at any time. If you do, each other play must discard all non-encounter cards from their hand or lose eight ships to the warp.

revised.name: Galactose Intolerance
revised.body: Discard at any time. If you do, each other play must discard all non-encounter cards from their hand or lose eight ships to the warp.

original.name: Gamma Converter
original.body: As a main player or ally, after cards are revealed, you may discard any number of cards at random from your hand. For each card you discarded, add 3 to your total.

revised.name: Gamma Converter
revised.body: As a main player or ally, after encounter cards are revealed, you may discard any number of cards at random from your hand. For each card you discarded, add 3 to your total.

original.name: Nu'x'xian Orb
original.body: When a player plays a wild flare, if you have a colony in that player's home system, you may send one of your ships from that colony to the warp to cancel the flare and return it to that player's hand. (Each flare can be played only once per encounter.)

revised.name: Nu'x'xian Orb
revised.body: When a player plays a wild flare, if you have a colony in that player's home system, you may send one of your ships from that colony to the warp to cancel the flare and return it to that player's hand. (Each flare can be played only once per encounter.)

original.name: Plasma Coil
original.body: After card are revealed, you may play this tech, treating it as a +5 reinforcement card. After that encounter is resolved, discard this tech to the tech discard pile.

revised.name: Plasma Coil
revised.body: After card are revealed, you may play this tech, treating it as a +5 reinforcement card. After that encounter is resolved, discard this tech to the tech discard pile.

original.name: Protective NRG Halo
original.body: During the planning phase of an encounter in your home system, any player with a colony on the targeted planet may play a card faceup next to the hyperspace gate. If the main player makes a deal, the offense gains those cards. Otherwise, each card adds 3 to the defense's total, and the defense gains them at the end of the reveal phase.

revised.name: Protective NRG Halo
revised.body: During the planning phase of an encounter in your home system, any player with a colony on the targeted planet may play a card faceup next to the hyperspace gate. If the main player makes a deal, the offense gains those cards. Otherwise, each card adds 3 to the defense's total, and the defense gains them at the end of the reveal phase.

original.name: Rewards Distributor
original.body: Add the Reward Deck variant (ðŸ•®10) to the game. If it is already being used, or if you discarded attack cards with a total value of at least 21, add the Ultra Reward Deck sub-variant. Then, discard this tech and draw two reward cards.

revised.name: Rewards Distributor
revised.body: Add the Reward Deck variant (ðŸ•®10) to the game. If it is already being used, or if you discarded attack cards with a total value of at least 21, add the Ultra Reward Deck sub-variant. Then, discard this tech and draw two reward cards.

original.name: Solar Harness
original.body: At any time, you may place one flare faceup from your hand on this tech. This flare can be played, cannot be canceled, and is not part of your hand. (When this card is played, it returns to your hand like normal.) You may discard the flare on this tech at any time. If you need to draw a new hand, you must first discard the flare on this tech.

revised.name: Solar Harness
revised.body: At any time, you may place one flare faceup from your hand on this tech. This flare can be played, cannot be canceled, and is not part of your hand. (When this card is played, it returns to your hand like normal.) You may discard the flare on this tech at any time. If you need to draw a new hand, you must first discard the flare on this tech.

original.name: Xaq Attack
original.body: Before main players invite allies, you may give this tech faceup to a main player. They must invited you.

revised.name: Xaq Attack
revised.body: Before allies are invited, you may give this tech faceup to a main player. They must invited you.

original.name: X-Lot-L Pod
original.body: When more than one of your ships would be sent to the wapr, you may send one of them to any of your colonies instead.

revised.name: X-Lot-L Pod
revised.body: When more than one of your ships would be sent to the wapr, you may send one of them to any of your colonies instead.

original.name: Nanite Mining
original.body: When you draw a new hand, you may draw one additional card.

revised.name: Nanite Mining
revised.body: When you draw a new hand, you may draw one additional card.

original.name: Brainwave Tracer
original.body: Before encounter cards are selected, you may take a card at random from another player's hand. If you do, reset this tech and give it to that player.

revised.name: Brainwave Tracer
revised.body: Before encounter cards are selected, you may take a card at random from another player's hand. If you do, reset this tech and give it to that player.

original.name: Zap-O-Tron
original.body: Reset this tech to cancel one use of any alien's power, including your own. That power cannot be used again during this encounter. (This is treated as a Cosmic Zap, but is not an artifact.)

revised.name: Zap-O-Tron
revised.body: Reset this tech to cancel one use of any alien's power, including your own. That power cannot be used again during this encounter. (This is treated as a Cosmic Zap, but is not an artifact.)
